content:
hl7-fhircast-bot opened Issue #118

## May 2019 Ballot Comment: Security is not optional. Is that really required from a spec point of view?

Submitted by Ricardo Quintano Neira on behalf of @bvdh
Chapter/section: Overview
Url: https://fhircast.hl7.org/specification/May2019Ballot/index.html
Type: A-Q

Summary: Security is not optional. Is that really required from a spec point of view?

Comment: "In all cases the app authenticates to the Hub with an OAuth 2.0 bearer token.".

So, security is not optional. Is that really required from a spec point of view?

Existing wording: In all cases the app authenticates to the Hub with an OAuth 2.0 bearer token.

_This issue was imported by @hl7-fhircast-bot from the consolidated FHIRcast May 2019 ballot spreadsheet._

hl7-fhircast-bot labeled Issue #118

isaacvetter commented on Issue #118:

Proposed resolution: Persuasive
Proposed resolution comment: @Bvdh, as also stated in other comment resolutions, we're going to change the spec to make SMART/OAuth a SHOULD and not a SHALL. We'll update this wording to comply

wmaethner commented on Issue #118:

## :landline: II Working Group Vote (6-18-2019)
Block vote

@isaacvetter moved the following disposition, seconded by Ricardo Quintano Neira

Disposition: Persuasive
Disposition Comment: Will fix as described in the issue comments or by the commenter

:+1: For: 10
:expressionless: Abstain: 2
:-1: Against: 0

:tada: The motion passed! :tada:

isaacvetter commented on Issue #118:

Fixes in this commit: https://github.com/HL7/fhircast-docs/commit/396b691d236b0978919d11fbf00139a1dd721be5
